i always used vnc on windows ... but yeah it feels .. "off"
there are some apps.. acid:rip.. dvd:rip .. hmm.. k9copy
dvd::rip is the one I've tried and used
any of those happen to be command line and easy to use as far as you know?
well.. dvd::rip is pretty easy.. point and click interface..you get previews and most default settings are good

hmm ... yes ... what i'm currently attempting to achieve is to throw a dvd to my laptop, that would automatically convert it to a .avi and then back to my main box, which puts it onto the backup drive ... that's why i'm preferring a command line version
ah.. well.. dvd::rip is a front end for transcode.. so I guess you could use transcode manually
right ... *searches for transcode*
thanks ... seems to have enough options ... *scrolls down* .... jup .... more then enough options
you can also use pastebinit
yes.. but that one has some weird german pastebin server as default.. =)

Karsyth, if you remove wine/steam, it does not remove all the gcf's ... you can try and do " find / | grep *.gcf " or something along those lines. ...

no, sshd listens to both local and external connections by default (it did for me ... )
yes, that's a burning program

yes

it can do to just about 64gb with PAE
is PAE needed on 64-bit ubuntu? I've got to go read up on this.
no, only on 32bit. But it allows you to use 64gb on 32bit os.
